valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 105, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1870.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1870.3" n="A" level="2"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos aliquantum ex cotidianis sumptibus redundet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alienus ex eā facultate, si quam habet, aliquantum detracturus est,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquantum se arbitrentur adeptos ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 27</bibl>; and esp. with <hi rend="ital">partit. gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummorum aliquantum et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum negotii sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10</bibl></cit> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum et armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae et auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8</bibl>; 41, 16 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1870.4" n="B" level="2"> The <number>plur.</number> rare, and only in later Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanti in caelestium numerum referuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 33" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanta oppida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantis diebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—Whence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquantum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭ-quantō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (on the proportionate use of these forms with the <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> v. Beier ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl>; Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10</bibl>; Web. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 225</bibl>; Zumpt, Gr. § 488), <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in some degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather; considerably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a little</hi> (cf. aliquantus). </sense><sense id="n1870.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n1870.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquantum: Ba.</hi> Nam ut in navi vecta es, credo timida es. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Aliquantum, soror, <hi rend="ital">somewhat so</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (consolatio) mihi quidem ipsi sane aliquantum medetur, ceteris item multum illam profuturam puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: item qui processit aliquantum ad virtutis aditum (<hi rend="ital">has come somewhat near</hi>), nihilominus, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nisi meo adventu illius conatus aliquantum repressissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movit aliquantum oratio regis legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 23 al.</bibl>: huc concede aliquantum (<hi rend="ital">a little</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum ventriosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale sit, non tam definitione intellegi potest (quamquam aliquantum potest), quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to some extent</tr>, <tr>in some degree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris lectis aliquantum acquievi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutus aliquantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1870.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquanto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo non contra legem, sed etiam intra legem et quidem aliquanto,</quote> <trans><tr>not a little</tr>, <tr>considerably so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: terra etsi aliquanto specie differt, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1870.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> it has greater or less force, acc. to the context, <hi rend="ital">much more</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a little more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat more</hi> (the latter sometimes ironic. instead of the former; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl> Spald.; in class. prose very freq.; most freq. prob. in Suet.; but never perh. in poetry, except in the examples from the ante-class. per.). </sense><sense id="n1870.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquanto: Ch.</hi> Abeamus intro hinc ad me. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Atque aliquanto lubentius quam abs te sum egressus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto plus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus aliquanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius aliquanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:270" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed certe idem melius aliquanto dicerent, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae aliquanto planiores quam nostrarum navium,</quote> <trans><tr>much flatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit> <cb n="ALIQ" /> Herz.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto crudelior esse coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum majore aliquanto numero quam decretum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 86:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 86, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 79, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad majus aliquanto certamen redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; so id: 27, 36, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 62 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluta est navis aliquanto prius,</quote> <trans><tr>some time before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturius aliquanto lupinus seritur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> R. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto serius quam per aetatem liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">ante</hi> and <hi rend="ital">post</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto ante in provinciam proficiscitur, quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aliquanto quam est mortuus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illos aliquanto post venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticum post aliquanto Q. Catulus fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 102</bibl></cit>: atque ille primo quidem negavit; post autem aliquanto (<hi rend="ital">but some time afterwards</hi>) surrexit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea aliquanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1870.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquantum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum ad rem est avidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse aliquantum iniquior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum amplior augustiorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum taetrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Garumna aliquantum plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aliquatenus: <entryFree id="n1871" type="main" key="a^li^qua_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquātĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>aliquā-tenus</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n1871.0" n="I" level="1"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">for a certain distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Padus aliquatenus exilis et macer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1871.1" n="II" level="1"> Of actions. </sense><sense id="n1871.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To a certain degree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in some measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquatenus, inquit, dolere, aliquatenus timere permitte: sed illud aliquatenus longe producitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquatenus se confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:59" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 59</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n1871.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In some respects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed istud (dicendi genus) defenditur aliquatenus aetate, dignitate, auctoritate (dicentium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO">11, 3, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quoque Aristoteles aliquatenus novat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philistus, ut multo inferior, ita aliquatenus lucidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules aliquatenus rubentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 80, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquatenus culpae reus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 5, § 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aliqui: <entryFree id="n1872" type="main" key="a^li^qui"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭqui</orth>, <itype>aliqua</itype>, aliquod; <number>plur.</number> aliqui, aliquae, aliqua [alius-qui; v. aliquis] (the <sense id="n1872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. fem. sing.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> were originally aliquae, analogous to the simple quae, from qui: <cit><quote lang="la">tam quam aliquae res Verberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 263</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 2</bibl> MS.; but the adj. signif. of the word caused the change into aliqua; on the other hand, a change of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. fem. sing.</hi> alicujus and alicui into aliquae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 133</bibl> P., seems to have been little imitated.—Alicui, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> aliquibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">oftener aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 55</bibl>; cf. aliquis), <hi rend="ital">indef. adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any</hi> (designating an object acc. to its properties or attributes; while by aliquis, aliquid, as <hi rend="ital">subst. pron.</hi>, an object is designated individually by name; cf. Jahn in his Jahrb. 1831, III. 73, and the commentators on the passages below). </sense><sense id="n1872.1" n="I" level="1"> In opp. to a definite object: <cit><quote lang="la">quod certe, si est aliqui sensus in morte praeclarorum virorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:62:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 62, 131</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi qui deusvel casus aliqui subvenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 1</bibl></cit> iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte aliqui inter dicendum effulserit extemporalis color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 5</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc enim populo deligitur aliqui dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ab eā deus aliqui requirat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. Pr. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit> iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">an tibi erit quaerendus anularius aliqui?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 86</bibl></cit> iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia (persona) adjungitur, quam casus aliqui aut tempus imponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 115</bibl></cit> iid.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 33</bibl> iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis aliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 147</bibl></cit> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">harum sententiarum quae vera sit, deus aliqui viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui talis terror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16, 35</bibl></cit>, and 5, 21, 62 iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">si te dolor aliqui corporis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1</bibl></cit> iid.; and many other passages, where transcribers or editors have ignorantly substituted aliquis; cf. also Heind. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut aliqua pars laboris minuatur mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 42</bibl></cit> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo aliqua significatio virtutis adpareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum repetes a proximo tuo rem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam id sine aliquā justā causā existimarem te fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquae laudes, aliqua pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquae mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: aliquod rasum argenteum,<cb n="ALIQ" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rasum aënum aliquod,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evadet in aliquod magnum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui appropinquans aliquod malum metuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in mentibus hominum tamquam oraculum aliquod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:48:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 48, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si habuerit aliquod juramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: sive plura sunt, sive aliquod unum, or <hi rend="ital">some one</hi> only, Cic. de Or, 2, 72, 292: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aliquas suscipiam molestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,037:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 13, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necubi aut motus alicujus aut fulgor armorum fraudem detegeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illa peregrinatio detrimentum aliquod afferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me credit aliquam sibi fallaciam portare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui alicui rei est (sc. aptus),</quote> <trans><tr>who is fitted for something</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: demonstrativum genus est, quod tribuitur in alicujus certae personae laudem aut vituperationem, <hi rend="ital">to the praise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blame of some particular person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui Graeculo otioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totiens alicui chartae sua vincula dempsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenies aliquo cum percussore jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:173 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 173 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1872.2" n="II" level="1"> In opp. to no, none, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorabo aliquo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut huic malo aliquam producam moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim quom ita animum induxti tuum, Quod cuperes, aliquo pacto efficiundum tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 13</bibl></cit> (= quoquo modo, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec enim ille aliquā ex parte habebat,</quote> <trans><tr>in some degree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 38</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (te habere), quod aut hoc aut aliquo rei publicae statu timeas,</quote> <trans><tr>in any condition whatever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: nec dubitare, quin aut aliquā re publicā sis futurus, qui esse debes; <cit><quote lang="la">aut perditā, non afflictiore conditione quam ceteri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesta res exspectatur, quam quidem aut jam esse aliquam aut appropinquare confido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: intelleges te aliquid habere, quod speres; <cit><quote lang="la">nihil quod timeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Morbus est animi, in magno pretio habere in aliquo habenda vel in nullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin ejus facti si non bonam, at aliquam rationem afferre soleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 85, 195</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si liberos bonā aut denique aliquā re publicā perdidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—Pregn., <hi rend="ital">some</hi> considerable: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquod nomenque decusque,</quote> <trans><tr>no mean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. aliquis, II. C.—</sense><sense id="n1872.3" n="III" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">non</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neque</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">non.. sed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non fecero ei male aliquo pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec non ad aliquos amicos conqueri vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vidistis aliquam similitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Col. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tu neque negare posses nec cum defensione aliquā confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:55:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 55, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque figuras aliquas facietis vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 22, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleri tuo non mentem aliquam tuam, sed fortunam populi Romani obstitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1872.4" n="IV" level="1"> With numerals, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti\s</foreign>, and Engl. <hi rend="ital">some</hi>, to express an indefinite sum or number: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos viginti dies,</quote> <trans><tr>some twenty days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: quadringentos aliquos milites, Cato, Orig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 187, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua quinque folia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>, quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">introductis quibusdam septem testibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Miles. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres aliqui aut quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)s diakosi/ous me/n tinas au)tw=n a)pe/kteinan</foreign>, Thuc. 3, 111; v. Sturtz, Lex. Xen. s. v. <foreign lang="greek">ti\s</foreign>, and Shäfer, Appar. ad Demosth. III. p. 269).—</sense><sense id="n1872.5" n="V. A." level="1"> Sometimes with alius, <hi rend="ital">any other</hi> (cf. aliquis, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae non habent caput aut aliquam aliam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:46:147" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 46, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum aliud aliquid flagiti conficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc alienum est aut cum aliā aliquā arte est commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliusne est aliquis improbis civibus peculiaris populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 125</bibl></cit> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1872.6" n="B" level="2"> With alius implied (cf. aliquis, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">dubitas ire in aliquas terras,</quote> <trans><tr>some other lands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicant aut spe aut timore aut aliquā permotione mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mercaturas facerent aut aliquam ob causam navigarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 28, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:14:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 14, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aliquipiam: <entryFree id="n1873" type="spur" key="a^li^qui^pi^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquĭpĭam</orth>, a false read. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sest 29, 63</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl>, for alius quispiam, B. and K.</entryFree>
aliquis: <entryFree id="n1874" type="main" key="a^li^quis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquis</orth>, aliquid; <number>plur.</number> aliqui [alius-quis; cf. Engl. <sense id="n1874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somebody or other</hi>, i.e. some person <pb n="88" /> <cb n="ALIQ" /> obscurely definite; v. Donald. Varron. p. 381 sq.] (<hi rend="ital">fem. sing.</hi> rare).—<hi rend="ital">Abl. sing.</hi> aliqui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Nom. plur. masc.</hi> aliques, analog. to ques, from quis, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 133</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. plur. neutr.</hi> always aliqua.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> aliquibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">oftener aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 48, 49, § 131</bibl>.—Alicui, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">indef. subst. pron.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somebody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">some</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any</hi> (it is opp. to an object definitely stated, as also to no one, nobody. The synn. <hi rend="ital">quis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquis</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">quidam</hi> designate an object not denoted by name; <hi rend="ital">quis</hi> leaves not merely the object, but even its existence, uncertain; hence it is in gen. used in hypoth. and conditional clauses, with si, nisi, num, quando, etc.; <hi rend="ital">aliquis</hi>, more emphatic than quis, denotes that an object really exists, but that nothing depends upon its individuality; no matter of what kind it may be, if it is only <hi rend="ital">one</hi>, and not <hi rend="ital">none; quidam</hi> indicates not merely the existence and individuality of an object, but that it is known as such to the speaker, only that he is not acquainted with, or does not choose to give, its more definite relations; cf. Jahn ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 429</bibl>, and the works there referred to). </sense><sense id="n1874.1" n="I. A." level="1"> In gen.: nam nos decebat domum Lugere, ubi esset aliquis in lucem editus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl> (as a transl. of Eurip. Cresph. Fragm. ap. Stob. tit. 121, <foreign lang="greek">*)/edei ga\r h(ma=s su/llogon poioume/nous *to\n fu/nta qrhnei=n</foreign>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">Ervom tibi aliquis cras faxo ad villam adferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc videre saepe optabamus diem, Quom ex te esset aliquis, qui te appellaret patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam modo agatur aliquid!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facerem, ut hoc ne facerem,</quote> <trans><tr>I would do any thing</tr>, <tr>that I might not do this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit plerumque, ut ei, qui boni quid volunt adferre, adfingant aliquid, quo faciant id, quod nuntiant, laetius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis enim demersae sunt leges alicujus opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod motum adfert alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 53</bibl></cit>: te donabo ego hodie aliqui (<case>abl.</case>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; so, gaudere aliqui me volo, <hi rend="ital">in some thing</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">some way</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec manibus humanis (Deus) colitur indigens aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est tua ulla culpa, si te aliqui timuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in narratione, ut aliqua neganda, aliqua adicienda, sic aliqua etiam tacenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt aliqua epistulis eorum inserta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare aliqua, ferre quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero, utrum aliquid actum an nihil arbitremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: quisquis est ille, si modo est aliquis (i. e. <hi rend="ital">if only there is some one</hi>), qui, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:255" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 255</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl>, etc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc aliquis dicat mihi: Quid tu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 94</bibl>; 2, 2, 105; 2, 3, 6; 2, 5, 42, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 206</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Forsitan audieris aliquam certamine cursus Veloces superāsse viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua tibi spon sa est, haec tibi sive aliqua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 326</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1874.2" n="B" level="2"> Not unfrequently with <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Novo modo novum aliquid inventum adferre addecet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum aliquid advertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicabant esse profecto aliquid naturā pulchrum atque praeclarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ne diuturnum quidem quidquam videtur, in quo est aliquid extremum,</quote> <trans><tr>in which there is any end</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignum aliquid elaborare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid improvisum, inopinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid exquisitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid illustre et dignum memoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctum aliquid et providum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne aliquid faceret eis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 186</bibl></cit>, and 10, 547: <cit><quote lang="la">quos magnum aliquid deceret, Juv 8, 263: dicens se esse aliquem magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus aliquid et excelsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterius aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—Also with <hi rend="ital">unus</hi>, to designate a single, but not otherwise defined person: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unum aliquem confugiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 41</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 42</bibl>: id si ab uno justo et bono viro consequebantur, erant, etc.): sin aliquis excellit unus e multis; <cit><quote lang="la">effert se, si unum aliquid adfert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 136</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis unus pluresve divitiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: nam si natura <cb n="ALIQ" /> non prohibet et esse virum bonum et esse dicendiperitum: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non aliquis etiam unus utrumque consequi possit? cur autem non se quisque speret fore illum aliquem?</quote> <trans><tr>that one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:2" default="NO">1, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.3" n="C" level="2"> Partitive with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis ex vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex privatis audimus jussisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex principibus aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 7, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 11, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis de tribus nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de iis aliqui remanserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Reg. 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suorum aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectabam aliquem meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: succurret fortasse alicui vestrūm, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trium rerum aliqua consequemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetratum ab aliquo vestrūm,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum popularibus et aliquibus principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.4" n="D" level="2"> Aliquid (<case>nom.</case> or <case>acc.</case>), with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> or of a <hi rend="ital">neutr</hi>, <pos>adj.</pos> of <hi rend="ital">second decl.</hi> instead of the <pos>adj.</pos> aliqui, aliqua, aliquod, agreeing with such word: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenti aridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mdefensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—Very rarely in <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo loci morari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.5" n="E" level="2"> Frequently, esp. in Cic., with the kindred words <hi rend="ital">aliquando</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicubi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquo</hi>, etc., for the sake of emphasis or rhetorical fulness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperius locutus est aliquid aliquando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non despero fore aliquem aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: evadat saltem aliquid aliquā, quod conatus sum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 293, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 295, 17 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1874.6" n="F" level="1"> In conditional clauses with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod si</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid de summā gravitate Pompeius dimisisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: si aliquid (<hi rend="ital">really any thing</hi>, in contrast with nihil) dandum est voluptati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl>: quod si non possimus aliquid proficere suadendo, Lucc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod si de iis aliqui remanserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando aliquid tamquam aliqua fabella narratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis vobis aliquid dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 19, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquem, cui narraret, habuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquem nacti sumus, cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (puero) si aliquid erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi alicui suorum negotium daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid eorum praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.7" n="G" level="1"> In negative clauses with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius cavebat omnia, no aliquid vos timeretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, si tibi sit pecunia adempta, aliquis dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne alicui dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.8" n="H" level="1"> In Plaut. and Ter. collect. with a <hi rend="ital">plur. verb</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">tis</foreign>, Matth. Gr. 673): aperite atque Erotium aliquis evocate, open, <hi rend="ital">some one</hi> (of you), etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 111</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me adesse quis nuntiate): aperite aliquis actutum ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.9" n="I" level="1"> In Verg. once with the <hi rend="ital">second person sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Exoriare aliquis nostris ex ossibus ultor, Qui face Dardanios ferroque sequare colonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 625</bibl></cit>.!*? In the following passages, with the critical authority added, aliquis seems to stand for the <pos>adj.</pos> aliqui, as nemo sometimes stands with a noun for the <pos>adj.</pos> nullus: <cit><quote lang="la">nos quibus est alicunde aliquis objectus labos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Fleck.; <cit><quote lang="la">Et ait idem, ut aliquis metus adjunctus sit ad gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">num igitur aliquis dolor in corpore est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 82</bibl></cit> iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquis nos deus tolleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 23, 87</bibl></cit> iid.: sin casus aliquis interpellārit, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 8</bibl> iid.: <cit><quote lang="la">si deus aliquis vitas repente mutāsset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 41</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est aliquis oratorum campus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39</bibl></cit> id.: <cit><quote lang="la">sive sensus aliquis argutā sententiā effulsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit> id. A similar use of aliquid for the <pos>adj.</pos> aliquod was asserted to exist in Plaut. by Lind. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:6:399" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 6, 399</bibl>, and this is repeated by Klotz, s. v. aliquis, but Lemaire's Index gives only one instance: ni occupo aliquid <cb n="ALIQ" /> mihi consilium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 94</bibl>, where Brix now reads <hi rend="ital">aliquod.</hi></sense><sense id="n1874.10" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1874.11" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">alius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliud: some</hi> or <hi rend="ital">any other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing else</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum aliud aliquid flagitii conficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest fieri, ut alius aliquis Cornelius sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:B. VI. 21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. B. VI. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut per alium aliquem te ipsum ulciscantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est in alio aliquo salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aliud promittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1874.12" n="B" level="2"> And with the idea of alius implied, in opp. to a definite object or objects, <hi rend="ital">some</hi> or <hi rend="ital">any</hi> other, <hi rend="ital">something</hi> else, <hi rend="ital">any thing</hi> else: aut ture aut vino aut aliqui (<case>abl.</case>) semper supplicat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul prol. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem aliquid Antonio praeter illum libellum libuisset scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ipse occurrebat aut aliquos mittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum seditionem sedare vellem, cum frumentum imperarem ..., cum aliquid denique rei publicae causā gererem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 27, 20</bibl></cit>: commentabar declamitans saepe cum M. Pisone et cum Q. Pompeio aut cum aliquo cotidie <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 310</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl>: (Tiberius) neque spectacula omnino edidit; <cit><quote lang="la">et iis, quae ab aliquo ederentur, rarissime interfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.13" n="C" level="2"> In a pregn. signif. as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti\s, ti\</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">something considerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">important</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">great = aliquid magnum</hi> (v. supra. I. B.; cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(/ti oi)/esqe/ ti poiei=n ou)de\n poiou=ntes</foreign>, Plat. Symp. 1, 4): <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia in ducis, aliquid et in militum manu esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, esp., </sense><sense id="n1874.14" n="1" level="3"> Esse aliquem or aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to be somebody</hi> or <hi rend="ital">something</hi>, i. e <hi rend="ital">to be of some worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be esteemed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque fac, ut me velis esse aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aude aliquid brevibus Gyaris dignum, si vis esse aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quidquam stultius quam quos singulos contemnas, eos esse aliquid putare universos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstitit Theodas dicens se esse aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: si umquam in dicendo fuimus aliqu<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cic. Att. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quoque aliquid sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui videbantur aliquid esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>: quod te cum Culeone scribis de privilegio locutum, est aliquid (<hi rend="ital">it is something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is no trifle</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: est istuc quidem aliquid, sed, etc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid nupsisse Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Est aliquid de tot Graiorum milibus unum A Diomede legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid unius sese dominum fecisse lacertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:230" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina sunt aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crimen abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:484" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sunt aliquid Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n1874.15" n="2" level="3"> Dicere aliquid, like <foreign lang="greek">le/gein ti</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to say something worth the while</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diceres aliquid et magno quidem philosopho dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. Herm. ad Vig. 731; 755; so, assequi aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to effect something considerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etenim si nunc aliquid assequi se putant, qui ostium Ponti viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.16" n="3" level="3"> In colloquial lang.: fiet aliquid, <hi rend="ital">something important</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">may come to pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happen: Ch.</hi> Invenietur, exquiretur, aliquid fiet. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Enicas. Jam istuc <hi rend="ital">aliquid fiet</hi>, metuo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane, aliquid fiet, ne abi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.17" n="D" level="2"> Ad aliquid esse, in gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">to refer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relate to something</hi> else, e. g. pater, filius, frater, etc. (v. ad): <cit><quote lang="la">idem cum interrogantur, cur aper apri et pater patris faciat, il lud nomen positum, hoc ad aliquid esse contendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit> Halm.—</sense><sense id="n1874.18" n="E" level="2"> Atque aliquis, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in imitation of <foreign lang="greek">w(=|de de/ tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">and thus some one</hi> (Hom. II. 7, 178; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 201 al.): Atque aliquis, magno quaerens exempla timori, Non alios, inquit, motus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 67</bibl></cit> Web.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:171" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 1, 350</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.19" n="F" level="1"> It is sometimes omitted before qui, esp. in the phrase est qui, sunt qui: <cit><quote lang="la">praemittebatque de stipulatoribus suis, qui perscrutarentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quibus in satirā videar nimis acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui adiciant his evidentiam, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:section=63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, § 63</bibl></cit> (cf. on the contr. § 69: verum in his quoque confessionibus est aliquid. quod ex invidiā detrahi possit).—</sense><sense id="n1874.20" n="G" level="1"> Aliquid, like nihil (q. v. I. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>), is used of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Hinc ad Antonium nemo, illinc ad Caesarem cotidie aliquid transfugiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:84:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 84, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tw=n d) a)/llwn ou)/ pe/r ti ... ou)/te qew=n ou)/t) a)nqrw/pwn</foreign>, Hom. H. Ven. 34 sq. Herm.).— Hence the <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1874.21" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquid</orth> (prop. <case>acc.</case> denoting in what respect, with a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi> or <pb n="89" /> <cb n="ALIQ" /> <pos>adj.</pos>; so in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ti\</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in some degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to some extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vereor, ne tibi illum succensere aliquid suspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in me aliquid offendistis,</quote> <trans><tr>at all</tr>, <tr>in any respect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tamen aliquid usus ac disciplina sublevarent,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippi regnum officere aliquid videtur libertati vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nos aliquid Rutulos contra juvisse nefandum est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque circumcisio aliquid valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucens jam aliquid, incerta tamen lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid et spatio fessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. p. 259; Ellendt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.22" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭ-quō</orth> (from aliquoi, old <case>dat.</case> denoting direction whither; cf.: eo, quo, alio, etc.). </sense><sense id="n1874.23" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhither</hi> (arch.), <hi rend="ital">to some place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhere;</hi> in the comic poets sometimes also with a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> added, which designates the place more definitely: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquo ex urbe amoveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo abicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 13</bibl>, in cellam aliquam concludere): <cit><quote lang="la">ab eorum oculis aliquo concederes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demigrandum potius aliquo est quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aliquo impellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo advenire vel sicunde discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in angulum Aliquo abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem rus aliquo educere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, like <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>, etc.: migrandum Rhodum aut aliquo terrarum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.24" n="2" level="3"> With the idea of alio implied, = alio quo, <hi rend="ital">somewhere else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to some other place</hi> (cf. aliquis, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">dum proficiscor aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at certe ut hinc concedas aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te parentes timerent atque odissent tui, ab eorum oculis aliquo concederes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. p. 265.—</sense><sense id="n1874.25" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭ-quam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (prop. <hi rend="ital">acc. fem.</hi>), = in aliquam partem, <hi rend="ital">in some degree;</hi> only in connection with <hi rend="ital">diu</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multus</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">plures.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1874.26" n="1" level="3"> Aliquam diu (B. and K.), or together aliquamdiu (Madv., Halm, Dietsch), <hi rend="ital">awhile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for some time;</hi> also pregn., <hi rend="ital">for some</hi> considerable <hi rend="ital">time</hi> (most freq. in the histt., esp. Cæs. and Livy; also in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n1874.27" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non aliquando condemnatum esse Oppianicum, sed aliquam diu incolumem fuisse miremini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristum Athenis audivit aliquam diu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vincula conjectus est, in quibus aliquamdiu fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Dion, 3, 1: quā in parte rex affuit, ibi aliquamdiu certatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.28" n="b" level="4"> Often followed by <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postremo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tandem</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatur aliquamdiu pari contentione: deinde, etc., Auct. B. G. 8, 19, 3: cunctati aliquamdiu sunt: pudor deinde commovit aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos aliquamdiu inermos timuissent, hos postea armatos superāssent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia aliquamdiu fuit: postremo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi aliquamdiu atrox pugna stetit: tandem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 28, 4</bibl> and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n1874.29" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">donec</hi>, as a more definite limitation of time, <hi rend="ital">some time ... until</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a considerable time ... until</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimis aliquamdiu jacuit, donec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1874.30" n="d" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">for a long distance;</hi> most freq. of rivers: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus aliquamdiu Gallias dirimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:8 al" default="NO">3, 9, 8 al.</bibl>—Of the Corycian cave in Cilicia: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde aliquamdiu perspicuus, mox, et quo magis subitur, obscurior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.31" n="2" level="3"> Aliquam multi, or aliquammulti, <hi rend="ital">somewhat many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerable in number</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quantity</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt vestrūm aliquam multi, qui L. Pisonem cognōrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl></cit> B. and K.: aliquammultos non comparuisse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 17</bibl> Hertz: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquammultis diebus decumbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 10</bibl></cit>.—Also <pos>adv.</pos>: aliquam multum, <hi rend="ital">something much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to a considerable distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec defensio, ut dixi, aliquam multum a me remota est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276, 7</bibl></cit> dub.—And <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> * aliquam plures, <hi rend="ital">somewhat more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerably more</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam pluribus et amarioribus perorantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl></cit> dub.; cf. Hand, Turs.
