I. p. 243.—</sense><sense id="n1874.32" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (prop. <hi rend="ital">abl. fem.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n1874.33" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhere</hi> (like mod. Engl. <hi rend="ital">somewhere</hi> for <hi rend="ital">somewhither</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">antevenito aliquā aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: aliquā evolare<cb n="ALIT" />  si posset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quā evasissent aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.34" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to action, <hi rend="ital">in some way</hi> or other, <hi rend="ital">in some manner</hi>, = aliquo modo: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aliquā sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: evadere aliquā, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 293, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aliquā resciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>, and 4, 1, 19: aliquā nocere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquā obesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 295, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1874.35" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭqui</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (prop. <case>abl.</case> = aliquo modo), <hi rend="ital">in some way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somehow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quamquam ego tibi videor stultus, gaudere me aliqui volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 30</bibl></cit> (but in this and like cases, aliqui may be treated as the <hi rend="ital">abl. subst.;</hi> cf. supra, I. A.); cf. Hand, Turs. I. p. 242.!*? The forms aliqua, <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>, and aliquam, <case>acc.</case>, and aliquā, <case>abl.</case>, used adverbially, may also be referred to the <pos>adj.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭ-qui, ălĭqua</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquod</orth>.</sense></entryFree>
aliquisquam: <entryFree id="n1875" type="main" key="a^li^quisquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquis-quam</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquidquam</orth>, <sense id="n1875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any one whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing whatever</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. examples): <cit><quote lang="la">qui negat, aliquidquam deos nec alieni curare nec sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl></cit>, where B. and K. now read <hi rend="ital">quicquam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullos alicuiquam in servitutem dari placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin</hi> Gron., where Weissenb. now reads <hi rend="ital">alii cuiquam.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aliquo: <entryFree id="n1876" type="main" key="a^li^quo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquō</orth>, v. <itype>aliquis</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> B.</entryFree>
aliquot: <entryFree id="n1877" type="main" key="a^li^quo^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquŏt</orth>, <sense id="n1877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indef. indecl. num.</hi> [alius-quot; cf. aliquis], <hi rend="ital">some</hi>, <hi rend="ital">several</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not many</hi> (undefined in number; while <hi rend="ital">nonnulli</hi> indicates an indeterminate selection from several persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl>; cf. Wolf ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae, id Fam. 7, 18: aliquot abacorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot de causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2 al.</bibl></cit>— Without <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot me adierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā aliquot praetorio imperio redierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille non aliquot occiderit, multos ferro, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aliquotfariam: <entryFree id="n1878" type="hapax" key="a^li^quotfa^ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquotfărĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prop. <hi rend="ital">acc. fem.;</hi> cf. bi- quadri- multi- omni-fariam</etym>, <sense id="n1878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in some</hi> or <hi rend="ital">several places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">In eo (Picentium) agro aliquotfariam in singula jugera dena cullea vini fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aliquoties: <entryFree id="n1879" type="main" key="a^li^quo^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquŏtĭes</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquŏtĭens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>aliquot</etym>, <sense id="n1879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">several times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at different times</hi> (now and then in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): aliquotiens causam agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangere locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensus aliquotiens liberatus discesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 16, 2</bibl>: neque detrusus aliquotiens terretur, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1015</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquotiens usque ad mortem periclitatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 34, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campum descendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl>; cf. Lion ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aliquovorsum: <entryFree id="n1880" type="hapax" key="a^li^quo_vorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭquō-vorsum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>verto, vorto</etym>, <sense id="n1880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">toward some place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one way or other</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam jam aliquovorsum tragulam decidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alis: <entryFree id="n1881" type="main" key="a^lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălis</orth>, old form for alius; v. 2. alius <sense id="n1881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1882" type="main" key="A_li^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ālĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Elis, <foreign lang="greek">*)=alis</foreign>, Doric for <foreign lang="greek">*)=hlis</foreign> (only in Plaut. Capt.), <sense id="n1882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Achaia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum vendidit in Alide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ālĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alisales: <entryFree id="n1883" type="main" key="Alisales"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Alisales</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n1883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe of Spain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alisma: <entryFree id="n1884" type="greek" key="a^lisma^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălismă</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/lisma</foreign>, <sense id="n1884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aquatic plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water-plantain</hi>: Alisma plantago, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 77, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aliso: <entryFree id="n1885" type="main" key="A^li_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălīso</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălīson</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aleison</foreign>, Ptolem., <sense id="n1885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress built by Drusus near the present Wesel</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Liesborn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl>; cf. Mann. Germ. 81; 433.</sense></entryFree>
alisontia: <entryFree id="n1886" type="main" key="A^li_sontia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălīsontia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n1886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Moselle</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Eltz</hi>, or more prob. <hi rend="ital">the Alsitz</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 371</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aliter: <entryFree id="n1887" type="main" key="a^li^te^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭtĕr</orth>, v. 2. <itype>alius</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> D.</entryFree>
alitudo: <entryFree id="n1888" type="gloss" key="a^li^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>alo</etym>, in Gloss. Gr. Lat. as a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">trofh/</foreign>, <sense id="n1888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishment.</hi></sense></entryFree>
alitura: <entryFree id="n1889" type="hapax" key="a^li^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nourishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maro alituram feram et saevam criminatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alitus: <entryFree id="n1890" type="main" key="a^li^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭtus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> of alo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1891" type="main" key="a^li^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭtus</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>alo</etym>, <sense id="n1891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>, <cb n="ALIU" /> <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi>: Parentibus quotannis aurum ad abundantem alitum mittebat, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, Don. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aliubi: <entryFree id="n1892" type="main" key="a^li^u^bi^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭŭbĭ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. alius-ubi</etym>, a rare form for the contr. alibi, <sense id="n1892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elsewhere</hi> (once in Varr.; in Plin. far less freq. than alibi; never in connection with the negatives <hi rend="ital">non</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nec</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nec usquam;</hi> a few times in Seneca and in the Digg.) </sense><sense id="n1892.1" n="I" level="1"> Vetant hoc aliubi venti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 2, 2, § 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1892.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1892.3" n="A" level="2"> Repeated in different clauses: aliubi ... aliubi, <hi rend="ital">in one place ... in another; here ... there</hi> (cf. alibi): <cit><quote lang="la">aliubi cum decimo redeat, aliubi cum quinto decimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliubi pro aquā, aliubi pro pabulo pendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 14, 41, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1892.4" n="B" level="2"> Aliubi atque aliubi, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now here</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mutatio voluntatis indicat animum natare, aliubi atque aliubi apparere, prout tulit ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliubi atque aliubi diversa poena est,</quote> <trans><tr>in different places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem aquatilium genera aliubi atque aliubi meliora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alium: <entryFree id="n1893" type="main" key="a_lium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ālium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. allium.</entryFree>
aliunde: <entryFree id="n1894" type="main" key="a^li^unde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭunde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. alius-unde</etym>. <sense id="n1894.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From another place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">person</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from a different place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">person</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/lloqen</foreign> (most freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliunde ipsi porro (nomen) traxere,</quote> <trans><tr>from some other place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 133</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 522</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1020" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1020</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum assumpto aliunde uti bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: ascendit aliunde (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)llaxo/qen</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 10, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n1894.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1894.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi> which are regularly constr with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, like pendere, mutuari, sumere, stare, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliunde pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliunde mutuati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliunde dicendi copiam petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 40, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliunde magis sues crassescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 18, 32, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Radice (thyi) nihil crispius nec aliunde pretiosiora opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo ut totum opus non aliunde constet,</quote> <trans><tr>of nothing else</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1894.3" n="B" level="2"> Repeated: aliun, de ... aliunde, <hi rend="ital">from one place</hi>, etc., .. <hi rend="ital">from another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aliunde stet semper, aliunde sentiat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be on one side and take part with the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardonyches e ternis glutinantur gemmis aliunde nigro, aliunde candido, aliunde minio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 75, § 197</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1894.4" n="C" level="2"> With the kindred words <hi rend="ital">alius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliter</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis aliunde est periculum,</quote> <trans><tr>danger threatens one from one source</tr>, <tr>another from another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui alii aliunde coibant, Liv 44, 12, 3: aliunde enim alio transfugiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>from one place to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliunde alio commigratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliunde alio transiliens,</quote> <trans><tr>from one subject to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 64, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1894.5" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fere aliunde (invehitur ad nos) quam ex Hispaniā,</quote> <trans><tr>from any place except</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 40, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sideri assidue aliunde quam pridie exorienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum populatio morum atque luxuria non aliunde major quam e concharum genere proveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34, 53, § 104</bibl></cit>.—With a somewhat changed expression in Cic.: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque aliunde mihi quaerendum est, ut et esse deos et quales sint di, discere possim, quam quales tu eos esse vis, for quam a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alius: <entryFree id="n1895" type="main" key="A_li^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ālĭus</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ālĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = Elius (v. Alis and Elis), <sense id="n1895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Elian; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town in Achaia</hi> (only a few times in Plaut. Capt.): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam belligerant Aetoli cum Aleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1896" type="main" key="a^li^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭus</orth>, <itype>a, ud</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> and <sense id="n1896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (old form, alis, alid, after the analogy of quis, quid: <cit><quote lang="la">alis rare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 28</bibl></cit>; Sall. ap. Charis, 2, p. 133; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alid more freq.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 263</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:257" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1305" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1305</bibl>; 5, 1456; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 13, p. 959</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. sing. masc.</hi>: alīus, rare, and not used by Tac.; for which alterius is com. used (v. alter); also alii, Cato and Licin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 194</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 918</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:28:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 28, 1</bibl>; Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 10, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Masc. dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Fem. dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl>) [cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)/llos</foreign>; Osc. allo (<hi rend="ital">nom. sing. fem.</hi>); Goth. alis; Erse, aile; O. H. Germ. alles, elles (<hi rend="ital">conj.</hi>); Engl. else], <hi rend="ital">another</hi>,<pb n="90" /> <cb n="ALIU" />  <hi rend="ital">other</hi> (i. e. of many, whereas alter is one of two, v. exceptt. under II. G.); freq. with the <hi rend="ital">indef. pronn.</hi> aliquis, quis, aliqui, qui, quidam, and the <hi rend="ital">interrog.</hi> quis, qui, etc. </sense><sense id="n1896.1" n="I. A." level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum sectam sequuntur multi mortales ... multi alii ex Trojā strenui viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios multos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures alios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliis pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ita dissolvit, ut omnes alii dissolverunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum aliud aliquid flagiti conficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nobis praeter med alius quisquam est servos Sosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam alius affuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem vel aliud quidquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 3, 35</bibl></cit>. utrum hanc actionem habebis an aliam quampiam; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid aliud dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 22, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ALIS NE POTESTO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datum Mi esse ab dis aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulo in alio occupato amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut aliae cujus desiderium insideat rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 918</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quam aliam quaerat copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid pater ait aliud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum est, Q. Fabium Labeonem seu quem alium arbitrum a senatu datum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque alid auget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Est alius quidam, parasitaster paululus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5</bibl></cit>. 2, 4; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo (judicio) stabis, si aliud quoddam est tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:237" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Aemilius alius vir erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Genus ecce aliud discriminis audi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius, ne condemnaretur, pecuniam dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 5, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo alius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 15, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus alimenti est in pane quam in ullo alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud esse causae suspicamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anne aliud tunc praefecti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne viris reliqui aliud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. 187:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Fragm. 187, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud auxilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud subsidii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia sumptuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt alia quae magis timeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 29</bibl></cit>: Facete is quidem, sicut alia, many <hi rend="ital">other things</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl> Madv.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aliaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:51 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 51 al.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, alio die, t. t. of the soothsayer, when he wished the Comitia postponed to another day, on the pretence of unfavorable omens: quid gravius quam rem susceptam dirimi, si unus augur alio die dixerit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 83</bibl> and 84 Wernsd. Perh. there is a reference to the same thing in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 52</bibl>: ita res divina mihi fuit: res serias omnes extollo ex hoc die in alium diem.—With <hi rend="ital">aliquis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quisquam</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ullus</hi> implied (cf. aliqui, V. B., and aliquis, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut, etiam si aliud melius fuit, tamen legatorum reditum exspectetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utar post alio, si invenero melius,</quote> <trans><tr>something else</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si in aliud tempus differetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B C. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an alium exspectamus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 4, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siti magis quam aliā re accenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sex legiones aliā de causā missas in Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque creatura alia poterit nos separare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 8, 39</bibl></cit>.!*? Instances of the rare <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> alīus: <cit><quote lang="la">alius generis bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:40:67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 40, 67</bibl> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">alius ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 7</bibl></cit> Madv. by conj.: <cit><quote lang="la">alius ordinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificis aliusve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Controv. Agr. 2:40:27" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Controv. Agr. 2, 40, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius coloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine vel ejus pro quo ... aut alius qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:24:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 24, § 6</bibl></cit>; v. aliusmodi.—</sense><sense id="n1896.2" n="B" level="2"> In comparisons, with <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, more rarely with <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi> and <hi rend="ital">quam;</hi> with the latter, in good class. authors, only when preceded by a neg. clause, or by an interrog. implying a neg.; cf. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 13</bibl>; instead of <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi> or praeter, and similar words, sometimes appear, <hi rend="ital">other than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different from</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n1896.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi sunt alio ingenio atque tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium esse censes nunc me atque olim quom dabam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest non solum aliud mihi ac tibi, sed mihi ipsi aliud alias videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:237" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe alia nobis ac tu scripseras nuntiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res alio modo est ac putatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui longe aliā ratione ac reliqui Galli bellum gerere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alius essem atque nunc sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe aliam esse navigationem in concluso mari atque in vastissimo atque apertissimo Oceano perspiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: aliud (se) esse facturum ac pronunciāsset, Nep. <cb n="ALIU" /> Ages. 3, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">alia atque antea sentiret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hann. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux longe alia est solis et lychnorum,</quote> <trans><tr>is very different</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (the latter is suspicious in Cic.; cf. Ochsn. Eclog. 252; Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">amare autem nihil aliud est, nisi eum ipsum diligere, quem ames,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing else than</tr>, <tr>only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ulla fuit causa intermissionis epistularum nisi quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat historia nihil aliud nisi annalium confectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid est aliud tumultus nisi perturbatio tanta, ut, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aliud agerem, nisi eum, qui accusatus esset, defenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est aliud Gigantum modo bellare cum dis nisi naturae repugnare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinaster nihil aliud est quam pinus silvestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lysander nihil aliud molitus est quam ut omnes civitates in suā teneret potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aliud huic defuit quam generosa stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nullo quippe alio vincis discrimine quam quod Illi marmoreum caput est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 54</bibl></cit>.—Hence, nihil aliud nisi or quam, = <foreign lang="greek">ou)de\n a)/llo h)/</foreign>, followed by <hi rend="ital">finite verb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing else than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi> (after these words, fecit, factum est may be supplied, or the phraseology changed to nullā aliā re factā; cf. Matth. Gr. 903; Hoogev. ad Vig. p. 475; <cit><quote lang="la">Kühn. Gr. Gr. II. p. 825): tribunatus P. Sestii nihil aliud nisi meum nomen causamque sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil aliud nisi de hoste ac de laude cogitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et hostes quidem nihil aliud (i. e. nullā aliā re factā) quam perfusis vano timore Romanis citato agmine abeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ab lictore nihil aliud quam prehendere prohibito, cum conversus in Patres impetus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut domo abditus nihil aliud quam per edicta obnuntiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox nihil aliud quam vectabatur et deambulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>.—So, quid aliud quam? <hi rend="ital">what other thing than? what else than?</hi> quibus quid aliud quam admonemus cives nos eorum esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid aliud quam ad bellum vocabantur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Quid Tullius? Anne aliud quam sidus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 199</bibl></cit>.—In affirmative-clauses rare, and only post-Aug.: <cit><quote lang="la">te alia omnia, quam quae velis, agere, moleste ferrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod alium quam se coöptāssent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2 al.</bibl></cit>—So, with the simple interrogative, quis alius? quid aliud? Qui, malum, alii? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid te aliud sollicitat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid aliud tibi vis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numquid vis aliud?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sed quis nunc alius audet praeferre? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid enim est aliud Antonius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid est aliud furere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid est alia sinistra liberalitas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 15 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1896.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/lla tw=n dikai/wn</foreign>, Xen. Mem. 4, 4, 25): <cit><quote lang="la">qui quaerit alia his, malum videtur quaerere,</quote> <trans><tr>other than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est aliud melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: nec quidquam aliud libertate communi quaesisse, <hi rend="ital">nothing else but</hi>, Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve putes alium sapiente bonoque beatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius Lysippo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusator alius Sejano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">praeter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nobis praeter me alius quisquam est servos Sosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam aliud est philosophia praeter studium sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est alius praeter eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogavit numquid aliud ferret praeter arcam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Num quid igitur aliud in illis judiciis versatum est praeter hasce insidias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam tela alia habebant praeter gladios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">extra</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque est alius extra te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 2. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,044:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Soph. 2, 15</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">absque</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non est alius Deus absque te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 17, 20</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">praeterquam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliud, praeterquam de quo retulissent, decemviri dicere prohiberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n1896.7" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1896.8" n="A" level="2"> In distributive-clauses repeated even several times, and also interchanged with non nulli, quidam, ceteri, pars, partim, etc., <hi rend="ital">the one ... the other; plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some ... others</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potes dicere cur alia defendas, alia non cures?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera tegentes alios, alios praegredientes amicos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: cum alii fossas<cb n="ALIU" />  complerent, alii defensores vallo depellerent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii experimentorum notitiam necessariam esse contendunt, alii non satis potentem usum esse proponunt, Cels. prooem.: quae minus tuta erant, alia fossis, alia vallis, alia turribus muniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 5</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl>, enumerating the different kinds of fever, repeats aliae seventeen times: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliis Q. Frater legatus, aliis C. Pomptinus legatus, reliquis M. Anneius legatus etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferebant alii purpuram, tus alii, gemmas alii, vina non nulli Graeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>: alias bestias nantes, alias volucres, serpentes quasdam, quasdam esse gradientes; earum ipsarum partim solivagas, partim congregatas; <cit><quote lang="la">immanes alias, quasdam autem cicures, non nullas abditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes partim interfecerant, alios in exsilium ejecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos alii ibimus Afros, pars Scythiam veniemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii superstantes proeliarentur, pars occulti muros subruerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes alius is omitted in one clause: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii eā spe dejecti navibus junctis, alii vadis Rhodani, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientes ignari in partem praedae suae vocatos deos, alios votis ex urbe suā evocatos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra metari placuit, ut opus et alii proelium inciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—Also with aliquis: <cit><quote lang="la">alia sunt tamquam sibi nata, ut oculi, ut aures: aliqua etiam ceterorum membrorum usum adjuvant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: [putat aliquis esse voluptatem bonum; <cit><quote lang="la">alius autem pecuniam],</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 60</bibl></cit> B. and K.; cf. Goer. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 20</bibl>.—Sometimes aliud ... aliud designate merely a distinction between two objects contrasted, <hi rend="ital">one thing ... another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numquam aliud natura, aliud sapientia dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:321" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fuit tempus, quo alia adversa, alia secunda principi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:72" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud est male dicere, aliud accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud est servum esse, aliud servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:60 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 60 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sciunt longe aliud esse virgines rapere, aliud pugnare cum viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, e.—</sense><sense id="n1896.9" n="B" level="2"> Alius repeated in another case, or with its derivatives, aliter, alias, alio, alibi, aliunde, etc. (but never with its derivatives in Tac.), in imitation of the Greek (cf. L. and S. s. v. <foreign lang="greek">a)/llos</foreign>, and Ochsn. Eclog. 110): simul alis alid aliunde rumitant inter se, Naev. ap. Fest. pp. 135 and 225; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Bothe, Fragm. Comic. p. 25: alius alium percontamur, cuja est navis?</quote> <trans><tr>one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacia alia aliam trudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerunt alii quidem alia quam multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa et ornamenta alia alio in loco intuebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>some in one place and some in another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2</bibl></cit>. 1, 22: <cit><quote lang="la">alius in aliā est re magis utilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius ex aliā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies alios alio dedit ordine Luna felicīs operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsi inter se alii aliis prodesse possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo multa conjecta sunt, aliud alio tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes Sardos venales, alium alio nequiorem,</quote> <trans><tr>one worse than another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: quo facto cum alius alii subsidium ferrent, <hi rend="ital">one to another</hi>, Fr., l'un à <cit><quote lang="la">l'autre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones aliae aliā in parte resistunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius aliā causā illatā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteros alii alium aliā de causā improbarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alii subsidium ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alio more viventes,</quote> <trans><tr>each in a different way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alii tanti facinoris conscii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 53, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii autem aliud clamabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi alias aliud iisdem de rebus sentiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>now this</tr>, <tr>now that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter ab aliis digeruntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 22, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites alii aliā dilapsi sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>some in this way</tr>, <tr>some in that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii alio mitterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>: Alis alibi stantes, omnes tamen adversis volneribus conciderunt, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit alios alibi fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.10" n="C" level="2"> Alius ex alio, super alium, post alium, <hi rend="ital">one after another;</hi> so often of the connection between ideas: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliud ex alio incidit, occurrit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud ex alio succurrit mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:C. 12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. C. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alid ex alio reficit natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 263</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1305" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1456" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1456</bibl>: sed, <pb n="91" /> <cb n="ALIU" /> ut aliud ex alio, mihi non est dubium, quin, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 14</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:18:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alio in aliud vicissitudo atque mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias ex aliis nectendo moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam ex aliā prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 364</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos alia ex aliis in fata vocamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae impie per biennium alia super alia es ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud super aliud scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ab eo magistratu alium post alium sibi peperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.11" n="D" level="2"> Alius atque alius or alius aliusque, <hi rend="ital">the one and the other; now this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now that; different</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem res saepe aut probatur aut reicitur, alio atque alio elata verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio atque alio loco requiescere,</quote> <trans><tr>in different places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inchoata res aliis atque aliis de causis dilata erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud ejus subinde atque aliud facientes initium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alia atque alia appetendo loca munirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites trans flumen aliis atque aliis locis traiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna alio atque alio loco exoritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres aliae aliaeque subinde oriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer aliis aliisque signis discernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis atque aliis causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl></cit>.—In Sall. also alius deinde alius or alius post alius: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe tentantes agros alia deinde alia loca petiverant, J. 18, 7: alias deinde alias morae causas facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis post aliis minitari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.12" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of another kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">different;</hi> hence, alium facere, <hi rend="ital">to make different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform;</hi> and alium fleri, <hi rend="ital">to become different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wholly changed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc haec dies aliam vitam affert, alios mores postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit> (aliam vitam pro diversam, contrariam, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">alium nunc censes esse me atque olim cum dabam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Huic aliud mercedis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe alia mihi mens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vos aliam potatis aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus non alius cuiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensesque recondit mors alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:806" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostensus est in aliā effigie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 16, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gal. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jac. 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium fecisti me, alius ad te veneram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: alius nunc fieri volo, id. Poen. prol. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines alii facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutaberis in virum alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. supra, II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Hence, in alia omnia ire, transire, or discedere, sc. vota, <hi rend="ital">to differ from the thing proposed;</hi> and in gen., <hi rend="ital">to reject</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oppose it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go over to the opposite side</hi>: qui hoc censetis, illuc transite; <cit><quote lang="la">qui alia omnia, in hanc partem: his verbis praeit ominis videlicet causā, ne dicat: qui non censetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens eum senatus reliquit et in alia omnia discessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tribus legatis frequentes ierunt in alia omnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit> Manut.: cum prima M. Marcelli sententia pronunciata esset, frequens senatus in alia omnia iit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discessionem faciente Marcello, senatus frequens in alia omnia transiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:53" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 53</bibl></cit>: aliud or alias res agere, v. ago, II. 7.—</sense><sense id="n1896.13" n="F" level="1"> Of that which remains of a whole, = reliquus, ceteri, <hi rend="ital">the rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the remainder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Divitiaco ex aliis Gallis maximam fidem habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter primos atrox proelium fuit, alia multitudo terga vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus aliud trucidatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in testudinem glomerabantur et alii tela incutiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alios incessus hostis clausisset, unum reliquum aestas impediret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n1896.14" n="G" level="1"> Like alter, <hi rend="ital">one of two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the other of two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic fuerunt filii nati duo, alium servus surpuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> arg. 2 and 9: eis genus, aetas, eloquentia prope aequalia fuere; <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo animi par, item gloria, sed alia alii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 1</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">duo Romani super alium alius corruerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>one upon the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita duo deinceps reges, alius aliā viā, civitatem auxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>each in a different way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marique alio Nicopolim ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit> (<hi rend="ital">Ionio</hi>, Halm); so, <cit><quote lang="la">alias partes fovere,</quote> <trans><tr>the other side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—Also in the enumeration of the parts of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia est omnis divisa in partes tres, quarum unam incolunt Belgae, aliam Aquitani, tertiam Celtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">classium item duo genera sunt: unum liburnarum, aliud lusoriarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mei/nantes de\ tau/thn th\n h(me/ran, th=| a)/llh| e)poreu/onto</foreign>, Xen. <cb n="ALIU" /> Anab. 3, 4, 1; and so the Vulg.: Aliā die profecti, <hi rend="ital">the next day</hi>, Act. 21, 8).—Hence, alius with a proper name used as an appell. (cf. alter): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis alius Ariovistus regno Galliarum potiretur,</quote> <trans><tr>a second Ariovistus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius Nero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.15" n="H" level="1"> A peculiar enhancement of the idea is produced by alius with a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi> and the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier, quā mulier alia nulla est pulchrior,</quote> <trans><tr>than whom no other woman is more beautiful</tr>, <tr>to whom no other woman is equal in beauty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus, quo non fortius ausit alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fama malum quā non aliud velocius ullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo neque melius neque amplius aliud in naturā mortalium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non aliud atrocius visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sulla) neque consilio neque manu priorem alium pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque majus aliud neque praestabilius invenias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alia ante Romana pugna atrocior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 7 al.</bibl>; cf. under aliter, 2. b. <foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>.—Hence the <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1896.16" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (an old <case>dat.</case> form, designating direction to a place; cf.: eo, quo), <hi rend="ital">elsewhither</hi> (arch.), <hi rend="ital">elsewhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to another place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">person</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/llose</foreign> (class., esp. among poets; but not found in Lucr. or Juv.). </sense><sense id="n1896.17" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n1896.18" n="a" level="4"> Of place: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse tu profectus alio fueras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab Norbā alio traducerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatos alio maerebis amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrens alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam frustra vitium vitaveris illud, Si te alio pravum detorseris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arpinumne mihi eundum sit, an quo alio,</quote> <trans><tr>to some other place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando Romam aliove quo mitterent legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 30</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n1896.19" n="b" level="4"> Of persons or things (cf. alias, alibi, alicunde, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">illi suum animum alio conferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad illam me animum adjecisse sentiat): ne quando iratus tu alio conferas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 60</bibl></cit> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi narrata ferunt alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 57</bibl></cit>: tamen vocat me alio (<hi rend="ital">to another subject</hi>) jam dudum tacita vestra exspectatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53, § 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, si placet, sermonem alio transferamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam alio properare tempus monet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1896.20" n="c" level="4"> Of purpose or design: <cit><quote
