lang="la">appellet haec desideria naturae: cupiditatis nomen servet alio,</quote> <trans><tr>for another purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc longe alio spectabat,</quote> <trans><tr>looked quite elsewhere</tr>, <tr>had a far different design</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1896.21" n="2. a." level="1"> Alio ... alio, <hi rend="ital">in one way ... in another; hither ... thither</hi>, = huc ... illuc: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (i. e. in eā re) alio res familiaris, alio ducit humanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: alio atque alio, <hi rend="ital">in one way and another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil alio atque alio spargitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1896.22" n="b" level="4"> Alius alio, <hi rend="ital">each in a different way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one in one way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">another in another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ceteri quidem alius alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud alio dissipavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 39</bibl>.—So, aliunde alio, <hi rend="ital">from one place to another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassatione terrae aliunde alio (aquae) transferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. aliunde.—</sense><sense id="n1896.23" n="c" level="4"> Like alius or aliter with a <hi rend="ital">negative</hi> and the particles of comparison quam or atque; <cit><quote lang="la">in questions with nisi: plebem nusquam alio natam quam ad serviendum,</quote> <trans><tr>for nothing but</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: non alio datam summam quam in emptionem, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo alio nisi ad nos confugerent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 36, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. pp. 232-234.—</sense><sense id="n1896.24" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (sc. viá), <hi rend="ital">in another way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a different manner</hi> (in the whole ante-class. and class. per. dub.); for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 10</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">aliuta</hi> has been proposed; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:986" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 986</bibl>, Lachm. reads <hi rend="ital">alio;</hi> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 56, 2</bibl>, Weissenb. <hi rend="ital">alibi;</hi> and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 43, 2</bibl>, viā may be supplied from the preced. context; certain only in Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. p. 219.—</sense><sense id="n1896.25" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭās</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1014</bibl> P., and Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 769, an <case>acc.</case> form like foras; but acc. to Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 57</bibl>, and Hab. Syn. 79, old <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> like paterfamili<hi rend="ital">as</hi>, Alcmen<hi rend="ital">as</hi>, etc. In the ante-class. per. rare; only once in Plaut., twice in Ter., twice in Varro; in the class. per. most freq. in Cic., but only three times in his orations; also in Plin.). </sense><sense id="n1896.26" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">at a time other than the present</hi>, whether it be in the past or (more freq.) in the future. </sense><sense id="n1896.27" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">At another time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at other times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on another occasion</hi> (alias: temporis <cb n="ALIU" /> adverbium, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">a)/llote</foreign>, aliter <foreign lang="greek">a)/llws</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Orth. 2242</bibl> P.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Herz. and Hab., as cited above): alias ut uti possim causā hac integrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 49</bibl> (alias = alio tempore, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed alias jocabimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed plura scribemus alias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et alias et in consulatūs petitione vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil oriturum alias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—In the future, freq. in contrast with nunc, in praesentiā, tum, hactenus: <cit><quote lang="la">recte secusne, alias viderimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hactenus haec: alias justum sit necne poëma, Nunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: sed haec alias pluribus; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: quare placeat, alias ostendemus; in praesentiā, etc., Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 16, 28</bibl>.—In the past: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatores alias imperare soliti, tum metu mortis jussa exsequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias bellare inter se solitos, tunc periculi societas junxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—Freq. with advv. of time; <cit><quote lang="la">as numquam, umquam, and the like: si umquam in dicendo fuimus aliquid, aut etiam si numquam alias fuimus, tum profecto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio numquam alias dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ante alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non umquam alias ante tantus terror senatum invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando umquam ante alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 5</bibl></cit> (where the four advv. of time are to be taken together): <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnalibus et si quando alias libuisset, modo munera dividebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.28" n="b" level="4"> Alias ... alias, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/llote ... a)/llote; a)/llote me/n ... a)/llote de/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">at one time ... at another; once ... another time; sometimes ... sometimes; now ... now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alias me poscit pro illā triginta minas, Alias talentum magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 76</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:46:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 46, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potest quisquam alias beatus esse, alias miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentius alias, alias summissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alias bellum inferrent, alias inlatum defenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 57</bibl> al.; it occurs four times in successive clauses in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 99</bibl>.—Sometimes plerumque, saepe, aliquando, interdum stand in corresponding clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam sine usurā reddit (terra), quod accepit, sed alias minore, plerumque majore cum foenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminatio verborum habet interdum vim, leporem alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc alias fastidio, alias contumaciā, saepius imbecillitate, evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 58, § 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 15, 13, § 63</bibl>.—Sometimes one alias is omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">illi eruptione tentatā alias cuniculis ad aggerem actis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.29" n="c" level="4"> Alias aliter, alias alius, etc. (cf. alius), <hi rend="ital">at one time in one way ... at another in another; now so ... now otherwise; now this ... now that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et alias aliter haec in utramque partem causae solent convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii enim sunt, alias nostrique familiares fere demortui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11</bibl></cit> (Madv. interprets this of time): <cit><quote lang="la">illi alias aliud iisdem de rebus judicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deos) non semper eosdem atque alias alios solemus venerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iidem versus alias in aliam rem posse accommodari viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 54, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.30" n="d" level="4"> Saepe alias or alias saepe ... nunc, nuper, quondam, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">also: cum saepe alias ... tum, etc. (very common in Cic.): quod cum saepe alias tum nuper, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecimus et alias saepe et nuper in Tusculano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus de rebus et alias saepe ... et quondam in Hortensii villā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum pater et saepe alias et maxime censor saluti rei publicae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepe alias, tum apud centumviros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 39, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepe alias, tum Pyrrhi bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tum solum, sed saepe alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—In comparative sentences rare: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tamen libentius quam saepe alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:90" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 90</bibl></cit>.—So, </sense><sense id="n1896.31" n="e" level="4"> Semper alias, <hi rend="ital">always at other times</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in other cases</hi> (apparently only post-Aug.): et super cenam autem et semper alias communissimus, multa joco transigebat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.32" n="f" level="4"> Raro alias, <hi rend="ital">rarely at other times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on other occasions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut raro alias quisquam tanto favore est auditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.33" n="g" level="4"> Non alias, <hi rend="ital">at no other time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">never</hi>, = numquam (a choice <usg type="style">poet.</usg> expression, often imitated by <pb n="92" /> <cb n="ALIU" /> the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">non alias caelo ceciderunt plura sereno Fulgura,</quote> <trans><tr>never at any other time did so much lightning fall from a clear sky</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alias militi familiarior dux fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alias majore mole concursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>. 69; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 31: non sane alias exercitatior Britannia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud alias intentior populus plus vocis permisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 11</bibl></cit>, and 15, 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.34" n="2" level="3"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">at another place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elsewhere;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in respect of other things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in other circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi> (only post-Aug.; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Idaeus rubus appellatus est, quoniam in Idā, non alias, nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 75, § 123</bibl></cit> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">alius</hi>): nusquam alias tam torrens fretum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut vir alias doctissimus Cornutus existimat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.35" n="3" level="3"> Alias for alioqui (only post-Aug.), to indicate that something is in a different condition in one instance, not in others, <hi rend="ital">except that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Silaro non virgulta modo immersa, verum et folia lapidescunt, alias salubri potu ejus aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:163" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 48, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2, 6, § 16 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1896.36" n="4" level="3"> Non alias quam, <hi rend="ital">for no other reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on no other condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in no other circumstances than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not other than;</hi> and non alias nisi, <hi rend="ital">on no other condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi> (prob. taken from the lang. of common life): <cit><quote lang="la">non alias magis indoluisse Caesarem ferunt quam quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debilitatum vulnere jacuisse non alias quam simulatione mortis tutiorem,</quote> <trans><tr>by nothing safer than by feigning death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:16" default="NO">8, 14, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:7:6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 7, 6, § 2</bibl>: non alias (<hi rend="ital">on no other condition</hi>) existet heres ex substitutione nisi, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:37:23:3:29" default="NO">23, 3, 37, 23, 3, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.37" n="5" level="3"> Alias like aliter, <hi rend="ital">in another manner;</hi> flrst in the Lat. of the jurists (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 71</bibl> Oud.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 56, 2</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 49</bibl> Ruhnk.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:8:8:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 8, 8, § 8</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. pp. 219-227. —</sense><sense id="n1896.38" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭtĕr</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>alis; v. alius <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in another manner</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/llws</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n1896.39" n="1" level="3"> With comparative-clause expressed; constr. both affirm. and neg. without distinction. </sense><sense id="n1896.40" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, and rarely <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different from what</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed aliter atque ostenderam facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter ac nos vellemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo tu aliter sentias atque ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 22, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliter nos faciant quam aequum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliter quippiam coacti faciant quam libere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sed si aliter ut dixi accidisset, quī possem queri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.41" n="b" level="4"> Non (or haud) aliter, <hi rend="ital">not otherwise</hi> (per litoten), = <hi rend="ital">just as;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">quam si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non aliter quam si ruat omnis Karthago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividor haud aliter quam si mea membra relinquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in senatu actum aliter quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:9" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 63, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi negabant se aliter ituros quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 51, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliter quam si mihi tradatur, etc., Quint. prooem. 5: ut non aliter ratio constet quam si uni reddatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non aliter quam si fecisset Juno maritum Insanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:619" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 619</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter quam cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:209" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 209</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 623</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 348</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 516 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec scripsi aliter ac si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14</bibl> (15), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">Non aliter quam qui lembum subigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter praeformidat quam qui ferrum medici, priusquam curetur, aspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:11" default="NO">2, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aliter quam ii, qui traduntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patere inde aliquid decrescere, non aliter quam Institor hibernae tegetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:220" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorem non aliter quam indicium mortis accepturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 30</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n1896.42" n="c" level="4"> Aliter ab aliquo (analog. to alius with the <case>abl.</case>, and alienus with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>), <hi rend="ital">differently from any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultores regionum multo aliter a ceteris agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.43" n="d" level="4"> Non ali ter nisi, <hi rend="ital">by no other means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on no other condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aliter obsistere fato fatetur se non potuisse, nisi etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:20:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl>: non pati C. Caesarem consulem aliter fieri, nisi exercitum et provincias tradiderit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14</bibl>; so Lentulus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes">38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:9:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:18:9" default="NO">48, 18, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n1896.44" n="e" level="4"> Non aliter quam ut, <hi rend="ital">on no other condition<cb n="ALIU" />  than that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aliter poterit palos, ad quos perducitur, pertingere, quam ut diffluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.45" n="2" level="3"> Without a comparative clause expressed. </sense><sense id="n1896.46" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in another manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in other respects;</hi> and in the poets: haud aliter (per litoten), <hi rend="ital">just so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vale atque salve, etsi aliter ut dicam meres,</quote> <trans><tr>though you deserve that I speak differently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 86</bibl></cit> Brix: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si aliter existimes, nihil errabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eadem ab utrisque dicantur, aliter dicuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>in a different sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:72:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 72, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si quis aliter docet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae aliter se habent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quippe aliter tunc vivebant homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: quod uterque nostrūm his etiam ex studiis notus, quibus aliter ignotus est, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, i. e. personally, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 23, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">negatives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit faciendum aliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ergo non aliter poterit dormire?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:281" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter haud facile eos ad tantum negotium impelli posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud aliter Rutulo muros et castra tuenti Ignescunt irae (the comparison of the wolf precedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud aliter (i. e. like a wild beast) juvenis medios moriturus in hostes Irruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 554</bibl></cit> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 473</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 642</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter (i. e. than I) Samio dicunt arsisse Bathyllo Anacreonta Teïum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Mordaces aliter (i. e. than by means of wine) diffugiunt sollicitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque exercitum Romanum aliter transmissurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliter expiari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 35, 33</bibl></cit>. —So, fieri aliter non potest or fieri non potest aliter (not fieri non aliter potest): nihil agis; <cit><quote lang="la">Fieri aliter non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: assentior; <cit><quote lang="la">fieri non potuit aliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.47" n="b" level="4"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1896.48" n="(a)" level="5"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the contrary manner: Pe.</hi> Servos Epidicus dixit mihi. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quid si servo aliter visum est? i. e. if he does not speak the truth? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum aliter evenire multo intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 4</bibl></cit> (aliter autem <hi rend="ital">contra</hi> significat, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">amplis cornibus et nigris potius quam aliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: ne aliter quid eveniat, providere de cet, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi> than harmoniously, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis aliter visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliter tibi videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: adversi ... saevaque circuitu curvantem bracchia longo Scorpion atque aliter (<hi rend="ital">in the opposite direction</hi>) curvantem bracchia Cancrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 83</bibl>: aliterque (<hi rend="ital">and in the opposite course</hi>) secante jam pelagus rostro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 197</bibl>.—Hence, qui aliter fecerit, <hi rend="ital">who will not do that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quis de his postea ad senatum referat, neve cum populo agat: qui aliter fecerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl>; cf. Brisson. de Form. p. 200, and de Verb. Signif. p. 66.—</sense><sense id="n1896.49" n="(b)" level="5"> Aliter esse, <hi rend="ital">to be of a different nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differently constituted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed longe aliter est amicus atque amator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: ego hunc esse aliter credidi: iste me fefellit; <cit><quote lang="la">ego isti nihilo sum aliter ac fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.50" n="(g)" level="5"> For alioqui (q. v. II. C.), <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in any other case</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus enim semper est quaesitum aequabile: neque enim aliter esset jus (and just after: nam aliter justitia non esset),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si suos legatos recipere vellent, quos Athenas miserant, se remitterent, aliter illos numquam in patriam essent recepturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter sine populi jussu nulli earum rerum consuli jus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter non viribus ullis Vincere poteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam ostentantes, si praesentia sequerentur: aliter nihil spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam aliter non possem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1896.51" n="(d)" level="5"> Like alius (q. v. II. A.) repeated even several times in a distributive manner, <hi rend="ital">in one way ... in another</hi>: sed aliter leges, aliter philosophi tollunt astutias. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter utimur propriis, aliter commodatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aliter catuli longe olent, aliter sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter Diodoro, aliter Philoni, Chrysippo aliter placet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem illud aliter Caesar, aliter Cicero, aliter Cato suadere debebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 49</bibl></cit>: Et aliter acutis morbis medendum, aliter vetustis; aliter increscentibus, aliter subsistentibus, aliter jam ad sanitatem inclinatis, Cels. prooem. p. 10.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">alius</hi> or its <cb n="ALLE" /> derivatives, <hi rend="ital">one in one way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">another in another</hi> (v. alius, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam aliter ab aliis digeruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ex locorum occasione aliter alibi decernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 30</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4, 10, § 29</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Non aliter, analog. to non alius (v. alius, II. H.) with a <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> (only in Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter utilius id fieri putare quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque non aliter clarius intellegi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 59</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 36, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:85" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 50, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:148" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 41, § 148</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. I. pp. 267-276.</sense></entryFree>
